data.chText: 小孩；年轻人
data.enText: a child or young person

data.chText: 一群年轻人在外面到处游逛。
data.enText: A bunch of kids were hanging around outside.

data.chText: 15岁的年轻人
data.enText: a kid of 15

data.chText: 她是个聪明孩子。
data.enText: She's a bright kid.

data.chText: 孩子们好吗？
data.enText: How are the kids (= your children) ?

data.chText: 你有孩子吗？
data.enText: Do you have any kids?

data.text: Kid is much more common than child in informal and spoken
在非正式场合和北美英语口语中kid远比child常见。

data.chText: 小山羊
data.enText: a young goat

data.chText: 小山羊皮革
data.enText: soft leather made from the skin of a young goat
handle/treat, etc. sb with kid gloves

data.chText: 小心应付某人
data.enText: to deal with sb in a very careful way so that you do not offend or upset them
kids' stuff
kid stuff

data.chText: 极容易的事；“小儿科”；小孩子都懂得的道理
data.enText: something that is so easy to do or understand that it is thought to be not very serious or only suitable for children

data.id-g-sent: a new kid on the block

data.chText: 戏弄；开玩笑

before.enText: usually used in the progressive tenses

data.enText: to tell sb sth that is not true, especially as a joke

data.chText: 他说他在与一位摇滚乐歌星谈恋爱，我还以为他在开玩笑呢。
data.enText: I thought he was kidding when he said he was going out with a rock star.

data.chText: 我并没有这个意思，我只是开开玩笑而已。
data.enText: I didn't mean it. I was only kidding .

data.chText: 我不是戏弄你，那的确有效。
data.enText: I'm not kidding you. It does work.

data.chText: 欺骗；哄骗
data.enText: to allow sb/yourself to believe sth that is not true

data.chText: 如果他们认为这会很容易，那是自己欺骗自己。
data.enText: They're kidding themselves if they think it's going to be easy.

data.chText: 我试图让自己相信一切都正常。

data.hoverText: 动词+名词短语 (+ that从句)

data.enText: I tried to kid myself (that) everything was normal.
no kidding

data.chText: （强调是真实的或同意别人刚说过的话）真的，可不是
data.enText: used to emphasize that sth is true or that you agree with sth that sb has just said

data.chText: “天气真冷！”“可不是！”
data.enText: ‘It's cold!’ ‘No kidding!’

data.chText: （表示认真）不是开玩笑，我说的是真的
data.enText: used to show that you mean what you are saying

data.chText: 我希望明天钱就能退回来。这可不是开玩笑。
data.enText: I want the money back tomorrow. No kidding.
you're kidding
you must be kidding

data.chText: （对对方刚说过的话感到非常惊奇）你是在开玩笑吧
data.enText: used to show that you are very surprised at sth that sb has just said
kid around

data.chText: 做傻事；装傻相
data.enText: to behave in a silly way

data.chText: 妹妹；弟弟
data.enText: a person's younger sister/brother

ex.enText: He is married with two kids/children.

synonyms.bx: 指孩童，常可与 child 换用。

ex.enText: How many children do you have?

ex.chText: 她班上有很多颇有天赋的孩子。
ex.enText: There are many gifted children in her class.

synonyms.bx: 相比 kid 而言较为正式，通常指 14 岁以下的儿童。

ex.chText: 别紧张，我只是开玩笑而已。
这个问题可不能拿来开玩笑。
ex.enText: This is not a matter to joke about.

ex.chText: 那位女演员和记者们开起了玩笑。
他们拿婚姻问题逗比尔。
ex.enText: They bantered with Bill on the subject of marriage.

ex.chText: 别生气，我只不过是开玩笑。
ex.enText: Don't get mad, I was only kidding.

ex.chText: 他说他在与一位女演员谈恋爱，我还以为他在开玩笑呢。
ex.enText: I thought he was kidding when he said he was going out with an actress.

synonyms.bx: 指通过告诉某人非真实的情况来戏弄他，通常用进行时。

ex.chText: 取笑残疾人是不礼貌的。
ex.enText: It's not polite to tease the disabled.

ex.chText: 他们过去常常取笑她的头发。
ex.enText: They used to tease her about her hair.

synonyms.bx: 指揶揄某人，或是善意的，或是为了让其生气或难堪。

data.enText: handle/treat, etc. sb with kid gloves

data.chText: 小心应付某人
data.enText: to deal with sb in a very careful way so that you do not offend or upset them
kids' stuff
kid stuff

data.chText: 极容易的事；“小儿科”；小孩子都懂得的道理
data.enText: something that is so easy to do or understand that it is thought to be not very serious or only suitable for children
a/the new kid on the block

data.chText: （地方、机构等的）新来者，新手
data.enText: a person who is new to a place, an organization, etc.

data.chText: 他已经从政六年，但很多人仍把他视为初出茅庐。
data.enText: Despite his six years in politics, he was still regarded by many as the new kid on the block.
no kidding

data.chText: （强调是真实的或同意别人刚说过的话）真的，可不是
data.enText: used to emphasize that sth is true or that you agree with sth that sb has just said

data.chText: “天气真冷！”“可不是！”
data.enText: ‘It's cold!’ ‘No kidding!’

data.chText: （表示认真）不是开玩笑，我说的是真的
data.enText: used to show that you mean what you are saying

data.chText: 我希望明天钱就能退回来。这可不是开玩笑。
data.enText: I want the money back tomorrow. No kidding.
you're kidding
you must be kidding

data.chText: （对对方刚说过的话感到非常惊奇）你是在开玩笑吧
data.enText: used to show that you are very surprised at sth that sb has just said
kid around

data.chText: 做傻事；装傻相
data.enText: to behave in a silly way

tr: a young person of either sex
example: `tiddler' is a British term for youngster

tr: a human offspring (son or daughter) of any age
example: they were able to send their kids to college

tr: soft smooth leather from the hide of a young goat
tell false information to for fun
be silly or tease one another
example: After we relaxed, we just kidded around

value.def: You can refer to a child as a kid .

example.ex: All the kids in my class could read.
example.tran: 我们班所有的孩子都能阅读。

value.def: Young people who are no longer children are sometimes referred to as kids .

example.ex: There were gangs of kids on motorbikes roaming around...
example.tran: 过去有成群结队的年轻人骑着摩托车四处游荡。

example.ex: That's a lot for a kid of 22 to cope with.
example.tran: 那对一个22岁的年轻人来说是够难应付的。

value.def: You can refer to your younger brother as your kid brother and your younger sister as your kid sister.

example.ex: My kid sister woke up and started crying.

value.def: If you are kidding, you are saying something that is not really true, as a joke.

example.ex: I'm not kidding, Frank. There's a cow out there, just standing around...
example.tran: 我没有开玩笑，弗兰克。外面有一头母牛，就站在附近。

example.ex: Are you sure you're not kidding me?
example.tran: 你确定不是在和我开玩笑吗？

value.def: If you kid someone, you tease them.

example.ex: He liked to kid Ingrid a lot...
example.tran: 他很喜欢捉弄英格丽德。

example.ex: He used to kid me about being chubby.

value.def: If people kid themselves, they allow themselves to believe something that is not true because they wish that it was true.

example.ex: We're kidding ourselves, Bill. We're not winning, we're not even doing well...
example.tran: 我们在自己骗自己，比尔。我们没有赢，我们甚至都没有发挥好。

example.ex: I could kid myself that you did this for me, but it would be a lie.
example.tran: 我可以欺骗自己你这样做是为了我，但那终究是谎言。

value.def: You can say 'No kidding' to emphasize that what you are saying is true, or that you mean it.

example.tran: 我很害怕。不是开玩笑，真的。

value.tran: （强调所说的是真实的或是认真的）真的，不是开玩笑

value.def: You can say 'No kidding?' to show that you are interested or surprised when someone tells you something.
You can say 'you've got to be kidding' or 'you must be kidding' to someone if they have said something that you think is ridiculous or completely untrue.

example.ex: You've got to be kidding! I can't live here!...
example.tran: 你在开玩笑吧！我不可能住这儿！

example.ex: 'He's a mild inoffensive man isn't he? — Oh you've gotta be kidding.'
example.tran: “他是个温和、没有恶意的人，不是吗？”——“啊，你不是开玩笑吧。”

value.tran: （表示认为某人所言极为荒唐或完全是假的）你一定是在开玩笑

value.def: You can say 'who is she kidding?' or 'who is he trying to kid?' if you think it is obvious that someone is not being sincere and does not mean what they say.

example.ex: She played the role of a meek, innocent, shy girl. I don't know who she was trying to kid...
example.tran: 她装作一个温顺、天真、害羞的女孩。真不知道她想骗谁。

example.ex: 'Maybe tomorrow will be better,' I said, hanging up. 'Who am I kidding?' I told Wolfe. 'Tomorrow will be more of the same.'
example.tran: “也许明天会更好，”我说着挂断了电话。“我在骗谁啊？”我对沃尔夫说。“明天还是一个样。”

value.tran: （表示认为某人不够真诚或不相信某人所言）她骗谁啊？/他想骗谁啊?

trans: 不是闹着玩的；也不跳；不是开玩笑；不骗你；开玩笑
末世纪叛逆天使；神童；电脑儿童
